department.dept_long_name: Committee on Degrees in History and Literature

course.title: Charlemagne in History, Story, and Myth
course.description: Charlemagne long has been seen as the mythic father of nation-states and precursor of a united Europe. We will approach Charlemagne not simply as a legend, however, but as a compelling historical figure. Beginning with the rise of the Frankish monarchy and the emergence of the Carolingian dynasty, we will turn to consider the figure of Charlemagne himself and the kingdom that he controlled, before exploring Charlemagne's historical, political, and symbolic legacy.
